citation.article-title: Pseudomonas xinjiangensis sp. nov., a moderately thermotolerant bacterium isolated from desert sand.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pseudomonas xinjiangensis sp. nov.
Pseudomonas xinjiangensis (xin.jiang.en′sis. N.L. fem. adj. xinjiangensis pertaining to Xinjiang, in north-west China, where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are Gram-negative, motile, non-spore-forming rods, 0.9–1.8×0.6–0.7 μm.
Pyocyanin on King A medium and fluorescent pigments on King B medium are not produced.
Growth occurs at 4–42 °C (optimum 37 °C), pH 6–9 (optimum pH 8) and at NaCl concentrations of up to 6 % (optimum 1–3 %).
Does not hydrolyse gelatin, casein or starch.

Shows positive reactions for nitrate reduction, but negative reactions for aesculin hydrolysis, gelatin hydrolysis, indole production, glucose fermentation and arginine dihydrolase, urease and β-galactosidase activities.
Assimilates adipic acid, but not d-glucose, l-arabinose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, N-acetylglucosamine, capric acid, malic acid, maltose, potassium gluconate, trisodium citrate or phenylacetic acid.

Positive for alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), lipase (C14), leucine arylamidase, acid phosphatase and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, but negative for valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase.
In Biolog GN2 plates, the type strain utilizes Tweens 40 and 80, pyruvic acid methyl ester, cis-aconitic acid and α-ketoglutaric acid.
Major fatty acids are summed feature 8 (C18 : 1ω6c and/or C18 : 1ω7c), summed feature 3 (C16 : 1ω7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH), C19 : 0 cyclo ω8c, C17 : 0 cyclo, C16 : 0, C12 : 0 and C13 : 0 3-OH.
Ubiquinone Q-9 is the major respiratory quinone.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 60.9 mol%.
The type strain is S3-3T (=CCTCC AB 207151T =NRRL B-51270T), isolated from desert sand in Xinjiang province, China.
